<Link id="l00038" /><CodeLine lineNumber="38"><Highlight kind="comment">/// Union of live intervals that are strong candidates for coalescing into a</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00039" /><CodeLine lineNumber="39"><Highlight kind="comment">/// single register (either physical or virtual depending on the context).  We</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00040" /><CodeLine lineNumber="40"><Highlight kind="comment">/// expect the constituent live intervals to be disjoint, although we may</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00041" /><CodeLine lineNumber="41"><Highlight kind="comment">/// eventually make exceptions to handle value-based interference.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00042" /><CodeLine lineNumber="42" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveintervalunion"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">class </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"><a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveintervalunion/#a2a70d7d591281375f770580181ca61ff">LiveIntervalUnion</a> &#123;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00043" /><CodeLine lineNumber="43"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// A set of live virtual register segments that supports fast insertion,</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00044" /><CodeLine lineNumber="44"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// intersection, and removal.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00045" /><CodeLine lineNumber="45"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Mapping SlotIndex intervals to virtual register numbers.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00046" /><CodeLine lineNumber="46"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="keyword">using </Highlight><Highlight kind="normal">LiveSegments = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/intervalmap">IntervalMap&lt;SlotIndex, const LiveInterval &#42;&gt;</a>;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00049" /><CodeLine lineNumber="49"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// SegmentIter can advance to the next segment ordered by starting position</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00050" /><CodeLine lineNumber="50"><Highlight kind="normal">  </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// which may belong to a different live virtual register. We also must be able</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><Highlight kind="normal">      LiveUnion = &amp;NewLiveUnion;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><Highlight kind="normal">      LR = &amp;NewLR;</Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141"><Highlight kind="normal">      InterferingVRegs.<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liverange/#aa1555194b9f176612b04fbd38f49b40d">clear</a>();</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00147" /><CodeLine lineNumber="147"><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00150" /><CodeLine lineNumber="150"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (UserTag == NewUserTag &amp;&amp; LR == &amp;NewLR &amp;&amp; LiveUnion == &amp;NewLiveUnion &amp;&amp;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00159" /><CodeLine lineNumber="159" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveintervalunion/query/#ab7eacb4ff3e11e61bbe97acaf46d47d8"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordtype">bool</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveintervalunion/query/#ab7eacb4ff3e11e61bbe97acaf46d47d8">checkInterference</a>() &#123; </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">return</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> collectInterferingVRegs(1); &#125;</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00164" /><CodeLine lineNumber="164"><Highlight kind="normal">      </Highlight><Highlight kind="keywordflow">if</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"> (!SeenAllInterferences || MaxInterferingRegs &lt; InterferingVRegs.size())</Highlight></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00186" /><CodeLine lineNumber="186"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Initialize the array to have Size entries.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00187" /><CodeLine lineNumber="187"><Highlight kind="normal">    </Highlight><Highlight kind="comment">// Reuse an existing allocation if the size matches.</Highlight><Highlight kind="normal"></Highlight></CodeLine>
